name: Department of the Treasury
description: The Department of the Treasury manages federal finances, collects taxes, pays bills, manages currency and public debt, and provides economic and financial policy guidance.

painPoints.point: IRS legacy IT systems requiring decommissioning - despite modernization progress, old systems still operational
painPoints.source: Federal News Network IT Modernization Report September 2025 & GAO-25-107611

painPoints.point: Incomplete or ineffective security requirements creating vulnerabilities in new systems
painPoints.source: Treasury Inspector General Major Management Challenges Report

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity threat monitoring gaps requiring Executive Order 14028 compliance
painPoints.source: Bureau of Fiscal Service FY2025 Budget - Cybersecurity Enhancement Initiative

painPoints.point: Paper records reduction and digital transformation challenges across IRS operations
Scaling IRS operations to handle Inflation Reduction Act clean energy tax credit administration
painPoints.source: IRS FY2025 Budget - IRA Funding Allocation

painPoints.point: Detection and audit log implementation challenges in new technology deployments
painPoints.source: TIGTA Major Management Challenges - Security Requirements

painPoints.point: Insufficient API standardization - need for unified application program interface across systems
painPoints.source: IRS IT Modernization Framework - Nine Strategic Initiatives

painPoints.point: Taxpayer service capacity constraints requiring enhanced technology and staffing
painPoints.source: IRS FY2025 Budget - Taxpayer Services Allocation $1.323B

painPoints.point: IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting critical financial systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

Taxpayer service technology improvements including $1.323 billion for Taxpayer Services
